review: I am not electronically knowledgable as some of the other reviewers on this product. I can only, simply, express my humble pros and cons on this product.PROS:1. Price was right- $50.00 from Target2. Most of the channels I streamed are free. Right now I am paying $15.00/ for Neflix and Hulu combined to get hundreds of programs between the two.3. I have streamed alot of programs. Movies, cooking programs, international programs, travelshows, Pandora, classic TV, documentaries and so much more.4. My choices, not packages that includes 200 channels and programs I don't watch; like the Kardashians and those other silly reality shows. Now, those are available if you want them on your list. But, I can do without them.5. Easy installation and setup.6. With it being plugged into my HDMI port, I get much crisper, clearer pictures.  Scenic shows/pictures are unbelievably beautiful.7. It will allow me to get rid of cable.CONS1. Sometimes there are interruptions during a program where the program has to be retrieved. Sometimes this can take several minutes.2. When the stick has not been used for several hours, I have experienced some connectivity problems where I have to reboot it by unplugging the power cord from the outlet and then replacing the plug.3. Screen freezing. i have had to call the Roku service department for help. The technician had me holding the reset button on the remote as well as other buttons on the remote. This maneuver was suppose to reboot the remote. Didn't work. Then I was to change the new batteries that came with the system. That worked for a few minutes. Now, I figured out that when my screen freezes up to remove the batteries from the remote and then place them back into the compartment. This reboots the remote and it's working.This is a headache because the batteries are not easy to remove. I have to use a case knife to remove the batteries. Roku has decided that my remote has to be replaced. They are sending me a new one free of charge.4. Also, you have free help service for 3 months I think, and then you will be charged about $9.00 to use their service which burns me.All in all I am very happy with it. It offers soooo much more than cable for far less money. Quality TV is whatever your choices are not what cable TV offers in their packages.
